text: Bhola-4 is a constituency represented in the Jatiya Sangsad (National Parliament) of Bangladesh since 2008 by Abdullah Al Islam Jacob of the Awami League. == Boundaries == The constituency encompasses Char Fasson and Manpura upazilas. == History == The constituency was created in 1984 from a Bakerganj constituency when the former Bakerganj District was split into four districts: Bhola, Bakerganj, Jhalokati, and Pirojpur. == Members of Parliament == {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Election!!Member!!Party |- |style="background-color:" | | 1986 | Saad Zagulul Faruk | Jatiya Party |- |style="background-color:" | | 1991 | M. M. Nazrul Islam | Awami League |- |style="background-color:" | | 1996 | Nazimuddin Alam | Bangladesh Nationalist Party |- |style="background-color:" | | 2008 | Abdullah Al Islam Jacob | Awami League |- |} == Elections == === Elections in the 2010s === Abdullah Al Islam Jacob was re-elected unopposed in the 2014 general election after opposition parties withdrew their candidacies in a boycott of the election. === Elections in the 2000s === === Elections in the 1990s === == References == ==External links== * Category:Parliamentary constituencies in Bangladesh Category:Bhola District
title: Bhola-4
